ground_truth: Rachel's head bobs up and down above the bush as we hear the unmistakable sound of a female hand on a child's bottom; all carry baskets as Rachel charges along at the head of the procession, while a cattle dealer strolls the other way. She keeps walking as they walk in silence. The waitress hurries away as Rachel dodges past a car, following the waitress and then the lovers in the car with her eyes. She takes in the lovers and sighs, angry at all women, herself included, and turns away. At the grocery store, the grocer is on his doorstep as she starts into the store with him; Rachel and the grocer come up to the counter where she stands with her market basket, reacting to wolf whistles off-screen, seeking the world. Ruby gestures Rachel’s nearness and nods as he turns and goes; Ruby, with an eye to the first loafer, turns and follows. John has entered in the background where Pearl holds the doll to her, and John moves in quietly to her side, standing together as they have often done before. As he turns around, she continues, puts aside the book, and takes up her mending, mending for a few moments as John crosses behind her and off towards the door. He approaches with two apples, gives her an apple, makes a move, and slowly and tenderly reaches out his hand, laying his fingers on her knuckles. Our heroine would like to thank the Lord openly but knows she must not show her feelings, so she speaks gruffly. Maybe we see, though John does not, the thanksgiving in her eyes as her head and shoulders from behind appear walking down the neon-lighted street, with the drugstore and loafers in the background and jazz music off-screen. Our two loafers lounge on a bench as Ruby approaches; he gets up and starts walking towards Ruby, catching his eye. She turns to a magazine stand and fingers a magazine, awaiting the loafer who approaches in the background; they are lurid, tawdry fan and pin-up magazines. The preacher enters between Ruby and the loafer and turns to Ruby into a close two-shot as the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at him admiringly, then to the loafers, back to Ruby finishing her soda, which is a familiar clue to the preacher, who then nods. It slides into his knife pocket as she looks after him, clasping the magazine under her chin, her hero strides away into darkness, gazing after him. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap and sobs as they weep together. She starts making up Ruby's hair like that of a young woman as Ruby nods and shrugs. Seeing the preacher, she drops two eggs. He tethers his horse and, as we pan and track on behind him, walks to the bottom of the steps as Ruby moves into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen door, hands folded under her apron.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Rachel's mind nods up and down above the shrub as we hear the unmistakable noise of a feminine hand on a youngster's rear; all carry hampers as Rachel charges along at the forefront of the procession, while a livestock merchant ambles the other way. She keeps strolling as they walk in silence. The server rushes away as Rachel evades past a vehicle, following the server and then the sweethearts in the automobile with her eyes. She observes the sweethearts and sighs, irritated at all women, herself included, and turns away. At the supermarket, the grocer is on his doorstep as she starts into the shop with him; Rachel and the grocer come up to the counter where she stands with her market basket, reacting to wolf whistles off-screen, seeking the world. Ruby gestures Rachel’s proximity and nods as he turns and goes; Ruby, with an eye to the first idler, turns and follows. John has entered in the backdrop where Pearl holds the doll to her, and John moves in quietly to her side, standing together as they have often done before. As he turns around, she continues, puts aside the book, and takes up her mending, mending for a few moments as John crosses behind her and off towards the portal. He approaches with two apples, gives her an apple, makes a move, and slowly and tenderly reaches out his hand, laying his fingers on her knuckles. Our protagonist would like to thank the Lord openly but knows she must not show her emotions, so she speaks gruffly. Maybe we see, though John does not, the gratitude in her eyes as her head and shoulders from behind appear walking down the neon-lighted avenue, with the pharmacy and idlers in the background and jazz music off-screen. Our two idlers recline on a bench as Ruby approaches; he gets up and starts walking towards Ruby, catching his eye. She turns to a periodical stand and fingers a periodical, awaiting the idler who approaches in the background; they are lurid, tawdry fan and pin-up periodicals. The preacher enters between Ruby and the idler and turns to Ruby into a close two-shot as the idler pauses in the background. She looks up at him admiringly, then to the idlers, back to Ruby finishing her soda, which is a familiar clue to the preacher, who then nods. It slides into his blade pocket as she looks after him, clasping the periodical under her chin, her hero strides away into darkness, gazing after him. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap and sobs as they weep together. She starts making up Ruby's hair like that of a young woman as Ruby nods and shrugs. Seeing the preacher, she drops two eggs. He tethers his steed and, as we pan and track on behind him, walks to the bottom of the steps as Ruby moves into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen entrance, hands folded under her apron.

She looks up at him admiringly, then to the loafers, back to Ruby finishing her soda, which is a familiar clue to the preacher, who then nods. It slides into his knife pocket as he is looked after by her, the magazine under her chin is clasped, her hero strides away into darkness, gazing after him. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap and sobs are shared as they weep together. Making up Ruby's hair like that of a young woman is started by her as nods and shrugs are given by Ruby. Seeing the preacher, two eggs are dropped by her. His horse is tethered and, as the pan and track is made on behind him, the bottom of the steps is approached as Ruby moves into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen door, hands folded under her apron.

test_cases.description: Rachel's head bobs above the bush as we hear a female hand on a child's bottom; all carry baskets as Rachel leads the procession, passing a cattle dealer. She walks silently, dodging a car, following a waitress and then lovers in the car with her eyes. Angry at all women, including herself, she turns away. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Rachel's head bobs rhythmically up and down above the dense bush, accompanied by the unmistakable sound of a female hand making contact with a child's bottom. All the individuals in the scene carry baskets, and Rachel charges forward energetically at the forefront of the procession, while a cattle dealer casually strolls in the opposite direction. She continues to walk purposefully as the group moves in silence. The waitress hurries away briskly as Rachel skillfully dodges past a car, her eyes following the waitress and then lingering on the lovers inside the vehicle. She observes the lovers intently and lets out a sigh, feeling a surge of anger directed at all women, including herself, before turning away. 

Upon reaching the grocery store, the grocer stands on his doorstep as she enters the store alongside him. Rachel and the grocer approach the counter, where she stands with her market basket, reacting to the wolf whistles that echo off-screen, as if seeking something beyond the immediate world. Ruby gestures to indicate Rachel’s proximity and nods as he turns and departs; Ruby, with a keen eye on the first loafer, turns and follows suit. In the background, John has entered the scene where Pearl holds the doll close to her, and John quietly moves to her side, standing together as they have done many times before. As he turns around, she continues her task, setting aside the book and picking up her mending, working on it for a few moments as John crosses behind her and heads towards the door. He approaches with two apples in hand, offers her one, makes a gentle move, and slowly, with tenderness, reaches out his hand, laying his fingers softly on her knuckles. 

Our heroine wishes to express her gratitude to the Lord openly but knows she must conceal her true feelings, so she speaks in a gruff manner. Perhaps we see, although John does not, the thanksgiving reflected in her eyes as her head and shoulders appear from behind, walking down the neon-lighted street, with the drugstore and loafers visible in the background and the sound of jazz music playing off-screen. Our two loafers lounge lazily on a bench as Ruby approaches; one of them gets up and begins walking towards Ruby, catching his eye. She turns her attention to a magazine stand and fingers a magazine, waiting for the loafer who approaches in the background; the magazines are lurid, tawdry fan and pin-up types. The preacher enters the scene, positioning himself between Ruby and the loafer, and turns to Ruby, creating a close two-shot as the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at him with admiration, then glances at the loafers, and back to Ruby, who is finishing her soda, a familiar clue to the preacher, who then nods. The item slides into his knife pocket as she watches him leave, clasping the magazine under her chin, her hero strides away into the darkness, and she gazes after him. 

Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap, and they both sob as they weep together. She begins to style Ruby's hair, making it resemble that of a young woman, as Ruby nods and shrugs. Upon seeing the preacher, she accidentally drops two eggs. He tethers his horse, and as we pan and track behind him, he walks to the bottom of the steps as Ruby moves into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen door, her hands folded neatly under her apron.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In the scene unfolding before us, Rachel's head moves in a rhythmic, bobbing motion up and down, appearing intermittently above the thick, leafy bush. This movement is synchronized with the unmistakable and distinctive sound of a woman's hand coming into contact with a child's bottom. All the individuals present in the scene are seen carrying baskets, and amidst them, Rachel energetically charges forward, setting a brisk pace at the very forefront of the procession. Meanwhile, a cattle dealer, displaying a casual demeanor, strolls leisurely in the opposite direction. As the group continues their silent march, Rachel walks with purpose and determination. The waitress is seen hurrying away at a brisk pace, and Rachel, with quick agility, expertly dodges past an oncoming car, her eyes initially following the waitress before they linger momentarily on the pair of lovers seated inside the vehicle. She observes the lovers with intense focus and subsequently lets out a sigh, feeling a sudden and overpowering wave of anger directed at her fellow women, including herself, before she eventually turns away.

Upon reaching the destination of the neighborhood grocery store, the grocer stands positioned on the doorstep as she makes her entrance. Together, Rachel and the grocer approach the counter, where she stands with her market basket. She reacts to the sound of the wolf whistles that echo distinctly from off-screen, as if they are seeking something far beyond the immediate surroundings. Ruby gestures to indicate Rachel’s proximity, acknowledging her presence with a nod before turning and departing. Ruby, with a sharp eye on the first loafer, turns and follows in the same manner. In the background, John has now entered the scene, where Pearl holds her doll close, and he quietly moves to stand by her side, replicating a familiar stance they have assumed many times before. As he turns around, she continues with her task, setting aside the book she was engrossed in and picking up her mending, diligently working on it for a brief few moments as John crosses behind her, heading towards the door. He approaches with two apples, offers her one, makes a gentle gesture, and reaches out slowly, with tenderness, softly laying his fingers upon her knuckles. 

Our heroine, with a deep desire to express her heartfelt gratitude towards the Lord openly, refrains from doing so, aware that she must conceal her true emotions, thus she speaks in a gruff and coarse manner. Perhaps, in a subtle manner, we notice what John does not—the thanksgiving that is clearly mirrored and reflected in her eyes as her head and shoulders emerge from behind. She walks down the neon-lighted street, with the drugstore and loafers creating a visible backdrop, accompanied by the faint sound of jazz music playing from off-screen. Our two loafers lie sprawled lazily on a bench, while Ruby approaches; one of them stands up and begins walking towards Ruby, successfully catching his eye. She shifts her attention to a magazine stand, casually fingering a magazine, patiently waiting for the approaching loafer who looms in the background; the magazines on display are of the lurid, gaudy, and provocative fan and pin-up types. Into this bustling scene enters the preacher, positioning himself between Ruby and the loafer. He turns to face Ruby, resulting in a close two-shot while the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at him with genuine admiration, briefly glances at the loafers, then back to Ruby, who finishes her soda, a gesture familiar to the preacher, prompting him to nod. The item discreetly slides into his knife pocket as she watches him leave, clutching the magazine under her chin. Her hero strides confidently away into the looming darkness, and she gazes after him with longing.

In a moment of emotional collapse, Ruby falls facedown over Rachel's lap, and together they both give in to their emotions, sobbing and weeping in unison. Rachel begins to style Ruby's hair, transforming it to resemble that of a youthful woman, and Ruby nods, offering a shrug of acknowledgement. Upon encountering the preacher, she inadvertently drops two eggs. He carefully tethers his horse, and as we pan and track behind him, he makes his way to the bottom of the steps, with Ruby moving into the side of the shot. Beyond the preacher, Rachel stands poised behind her screen door, her hands neatly folded under her apron.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rachel's head bobs rhythmically up and down above the bush, synchronized with the unmistakable sound of a female hand patting a child's bottom, creating a distinct auditory backdrop. Each person in the group carries a basket, and Rachel, with determined energy, charges forward at the head of the procession, while a cattle dealer casually strolls in the opposite direction. She maintains her pace, walking steadily as the group moves in silence. The waitress, in a hurry, moves away quickly, prompting Rachel to deftly dodge past a car, her eyes following the waitress and then shifting to the lovers inside the car. She observes the lovers intently, a sigh escaping her lips, filled with anger directed at all women, including herself, before she turns away. Upon reaching the grocery store, the grocer stands on his doorstep, and as she enters the store with him, Rachel and the grocer approach the counter together. She stands there with her market basket, reacting to the off-screen wolf whistles, her gaze searching the world around her. Ruby gestures towards Rachel's proximity and nods, then turns and departs; Ruby, with a keen eye on the first loafer, turns and follows. In the background, John enters the scene where Pearl holds a doll close to her, and John quietly moves to her side, standing together as they have done many times before. As he turns around, she continues her task, setting aside the book and picking up her mending, focusing on it for a few moments as John crosses behind her and heads towards the door. He approaches with two apples in hand, offering her one, and then makes a gentle move, slowly and tenderly reaching out to lay his fingers on her knuckles. Our heroine wishes to thank the Lord openly but restrains herself from showing her feelings, speaking instead in a gruff manner. Perhaps we see, though John does not, the thanksgiving reflected in her eyes as her head and shoulders appear from behind, walking down the neon-lighted street, with the drugstore and loafers in the background and jazz music playing off-screen. Our two loafers lounge on a bench as Ruby approaches; one gets up and starts walking towards Ruby, catching his eye. She turns to a magazine stand, her fingers lightly touching a magazine, as she waits for the loafer who approaches in the background; the magazines are lurid, tawdry fan and pin-up types. The preacher enters the scene, positioning himself between Ruby and the loafer, turning to Ruby in a close two-shot as the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at the preacher admiringly, then glances at the loafers, and back to Ruby, who finishes her soda, a familiar signal to the preacher, who then nods. The knife slides into his pocket as she watches him leave, clasping the magazine under her chin, her hero striding away into the darkness, her gaze following him. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap, sobbing as they weep together. Rachel begins to style Ruby's hair, transforming it into that of a young woman, as Ruby nods and shrugs in response. Upon seeing the preacher, she accidentally drops two eggs. He tethers his horse, and as the camera pans and tracks behind him, he walks to the bottom of the steps, with Ruby moving into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen door, her hands folded neatly under her apron.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rachel leads a procession with baskets in hand, passing a cattle dealer and a waitress, whom she follows with her eyes as she dodges a car. Observing a couple in the car, she sighs in frustration at women, including herself, and turns away. At the grocery store, she enters with the grocer, reacting to off-screen wolf whistles while standing at the counter. Ruby acknowledges Rachel's presence and nods before following her. Meanwhile, John quietly joins Pearl, who holds a doll, and they stand together as he moves toward the door. He offers her an apple and gently touches her hand, prompting her to suppress her gratitude and speak gruffly, though her eyes reveal her true feelings. As she walks down a neon-lit street, jazz music plays in the background. Ruby approaches two loafers lounging on a bench, catching one's eye. She browses tawdry magazines at a stand, waiting for the loafer. The preacher enters, engaging Ruby in conversation while the loafer lingers. She admires the preacher, who nods knowingly as she finishes her soda. He departs, and Ruby watches him disappear into the darkness, clutching a magazine. Ruby then collapses into Rachel's lap, and they weep together. Rachel begins styling Ruby's hair, and Ruby nods and shrugs. Upon seeing the preacher, she drops two eggs. He tethers his horse and approaches the steps, with Ruby moving into the frame, while Rachel stands behind her screen door, hands folded under her apron.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Rachel's head bobs up and down above the bush as we hear the unmistakable sound of a female hand on a child's bottom, a traditional gesture used by some cultures to express discipline or urgency; all carry baskets as Rachel charges along at the head of the procession, reminiscent of a parade leader guiding her followers, while a cattle dealer strolls the other way, perhaps returning from a livestock auction common in rural areas. She keeps walking as they walk in silence, each step echoing the rhythm of the rural town's heartbeat. The waitress hurries away as Rachel dodges past a car, an action that requires quick reflexes in the bustling street, following the waitress and then the lovers in the car with her eyes. She takes in the lovers, whose tender exchange contrasts with her own turmoil, and sighs, angry at all women, herself included, and turns away. At the grocery store, a cornerstone of small-town life where neighbors mingle, the grocer is on his doorstep as she starts into the store with him; Rachel and the grocer come up to the counter where she stands with her market basket, an essential item for her weekly shopping, reacting to wolf whistles off-screen, seeking the world that lies beyond her reach. Ruby gestures Rachel’s nearness and nods as he turns and goes; Ruby, with an eye to the first loafer, a term once used to describe idle young men, turns and follows. John has entered in the background where Pearl holds the doll to her, a symbol of childhood innocence, and John moves in quietly to her side, standing together as they have often done before. As he turns around, she continues, puts aside the book, a favorite pastime of hers, and takes up her mending, a skill passed down through generations, mending for a few moments as John crosses behind her and off towards the door. He approaches with two apples, a gesture of simple kindness, gives her an apple, makes a move, and slowly and tenderly reaches out his hand, laying his fingers on her knuckles. Our heroine would like to thank the Lord openly but knows she must not show her feelings, so she speaks gruffly, concealing her gratitude. Maybe we see, though John does not, the thanksgiving in her eyes as her head and shoulders from behind appear walking down the neon-lighted street, with the drugstore, a common meeting point in town, and loafers in the background and jazz music off-screen, a soundtrack to the scene that captures the era. Our two loafers lounge on a bench as Ruby approaches, a scene that reflects the town's leisurely pace; he gets up and starts walking towards Ruby, catching his eye. She turns to a magazine stand and fingers a magazine, perhaps seeking an escape into the glossy pages, awaiting the loafer who approaches in the background; they are lurid, tawdry fan and pin-up magazines, reflecting popular culture's fascination at the time. The preacher enters between Ruby and the loafer, a figure of authority and morality, and turns to Ruby into a close two-shot as the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at him admiringly, then to the loafers, back to Ruby finishing her soda, a favorite refreshment, which is a familiar clue to the preacher, who then nods. It slides into his knife pocket as she looks after him, clasping the magazine under her chin, her hero strides away into darkness, gazing after him with a sense of longing. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap and sobs as they weep together, their shared sorrow a testament to their deep bond. She starts making up Ruby's hair like that of a young woman, a gesture of transformation, as Ruby nods and shrugs. Seeing the preacher, she drops two eggs, their fragile shells shattering on the ground. He tethers his horse, a nod to the traditional modes of transport still used in rural communities, and, as we pan and track on behind him, walks to the bottom of the steps as Ruby moves into the side of the shot; beyond the preacher, Rachel stands behind her screen door, a common feature in homes to allow air circulation, hands folded under her apron.

Rachel stands behind her screen door hands folded under her apron.

test_cases.description: Rachel's head bobs up and down above the bush as we hear the unmistakable sound of a female hand on a child's bottom. all carry baskets as Rachel charges along at the head of the procession while a cattle dealer strolls the other way. She keeps walking as they walk in silence. The waitress hurries away as Rachel dodges past a car following the waitress and then the lovers in the car with her eyes. She takes in the lovers and sighs angry at all women herself included and turns away. At the grocery store the grocer is on his doorstep as she starts into the store with him. Rachel and the grocer come up to the counter where she stands with her market basket reacting to wolf whistles offscreen seeking the world. Ruby gestures Rachel’s nearness and nods as he turns and goes. Ruby with an eye to the first loafer turns and follows. John has entered in the background where Pearl holds the doll to her and John moves in quietly to her side standing together as they have often done before. As he turns around she continues puts aside the book and takes up her mending mending for a few moments as John crosses behind her and off towards the door. He approaches with two apples gives her an apple makes a move and slowly and tenderly reaches out his hand laying his fingers on her knuckles. Our heroine would like to thank the Lord openly but knows she must not show her feelings so she speaks gruffly. Maybe we see though. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. John does not the thanksgiving in her eyes as her head and shoulders from behind appear walking down the neonlighted street with the drugstore and loafers in the background and jazz music offscreen. Our two loafers lounge on a bench as Ruby approaches. he gets up and starts walking towards Ruby catching his eye. She turns to a magazine stand and fingers a magazine awaiting the loafer who approaches in the background. they are lurid tawdry fan and pinup magazines. The preacher enters between Ruby and the loafer and turns to Ruby into a close twoshot as the loafer pauses in the background. She looks up at him admiringly then to the loafers back to Ruby finishing her soda which is a familiar clue to the preacher who then nods. It slides into his knife pocket as she looks after him clasping the magazine under her chin. her hero strides away into darkness gazing after him. Ruby collapses facedown over Rachel's lap and sobs as they weep together. She starts making up Ruby's hair like that of a young woman. as Ruby nods and shrugs. Seeing the preacher she drops two eggs. He tethers his horse and as we pan and track on behind him walks to the bottom of the steps as Ruby moves into the side of the shot beyond the preacher. Rachel stands behind her screen door hands folded under her apron.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Molly's umbrella floats sideways above the fountain as we detect the unmistakable ring of a dog paw on a drum set; all hug lamps as Molly saunters along at the tail of the marathon, while a mailman dances the opposite way. She skips singing as they sing in silence. The baker scurries away as Molly skates past a tractor, following the baker and then the tourists in the tractor with her binoculars. She observes the tourists and whistles, exuberant at all clouds, herself included, and leaps away. At the flower shop, the florist is on his rooftop as she jives into the shop with him; Molly and the florist glide up to the telescope where she hops with her seashell, reacting to flute solos off-screen, questing for the cosmos. Oliver signals Molly’s proximity and blinks as he bends and floats; Oliver, with a wink to the first juggler, bends and flutters. Henry has dozed in the foreground where Lisa hugs the book to her, and Henry sneaks in silently to her elbow, standing apart as they have rarely done in the past. As he flips around, she continues, places aside the map, and picks up her juggling, juggling for several moments as Henry sneaks behind her and off towards the window. He dances with two bananas, hands her a banana, makes a twirl, and rapidly and casually extends his foot, resting his toes on her shoelaces. Our traveler would like to thank the engineer openly but knows she must not demonstrate her thoughts, so she whispers sweetly. Perhaps we sense, though Henry does not, the joy in her smile as her knees and elbows from afar appear skipping through the candle-lit alley, with the café and jugglers in the background and classical music off-screen. Our pair of jugglers bounce on a hammock as Oliver skips; he lies down and starts flying toward Oliver, catching his nostrils. She switches to a newspaper rack and strokes a newspaper, awaiting the juggler who skips in the foreground; they are bright, colorful kite and scrapbook newspapers. The detective skips between Oliver and the juggler and switches to Oliver into a wide face-shot as the juggler snoozes in the foreground. She stares up at him cheerfully, then to the jugglers, back to Oliver finishing her tea, which is a known hint to the detective, who then winks. It slinks into his flute pocket as she follows after him, cradling the newspaper under her elbow, her heroine skips away into dusk, peeking after him. Oliver tumbles upside down over Molly's knees and sings as they laugh in unison. She finishes trimming Oliver's grass like that of an old tree as Oliver wiggles and shrugs. Spotting the detective, she tosses two grapes. He brushes his jacket and, as we zoom and slide on behind him, stomps to the top of the hill as Oliver skips into the frame of the shot; beyond the detective, Molly peeks behind her curtain, ears buried under her hat.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Rachel leads a group, moving quickly and observing a waitress and lovers, feeling a mix of anger and self-reflection. At a grocery store, she encounters Ruby, who acknowledges her presence. Meanwhile, John quietly supports Pearl as they share a moment of silent camaraderie. As Rachel struggles with her emotions, she grapples with expressing gratitude, aware of unwritten societal rules. Ruby encounters a preacher while being pursued by a loafer, feeling admiration and familiarity. The preacher becomes a beacon, and Ruby follows him, symbolizing hope. Ruby collapses in Rachel's lap, and they weep together, symbolizing shared pain and understanding. Rachel then helps Ruby by styling her hair, indicating a transformation. The scene concludes with Ruby noticing the preacher, dropping eggs, and observing him with admiration as he becomes a symbol of hope and change.
